label: A3B4_hR7_166_ac_2c-002
title: Sn$_{4}$P$_{3}$ Structure
comments:
The Sn-P phase diagram has three known phases (Zavrazhnova, 2018): \begin{itemize} \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A3B_hR8_166_h_c-001}{SnP$_{3}$} \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A3B4_hR7_166_ac_2c-002}{Sn$_{4}$P$_{3}$} (this structure) \item \href{current_web_home_dir/A16B3_hR19_166_2c2h_ac-001}{Sn$_{3}$P$_{4}$} \end{itemize} ~ \vspace{-.25in} 
 Sn$_{4}$P$_{3}$ is the binary form of \href{current_web_home_dir/AB2C4_hR7_166_a_c_2c-002}{GeSb$_{2}$Te$_{4}$}. 
 \href{current_web_home_dir/A3B4_hR7_166_ac_2c-001}{In$_{3}$Te$_{4}$} and \href{current_web_home_dir/A3B4_hR7_166_ac_2c-002}{Sn$_{4}$P$_{3}$} have the same AFLOW prototype label, A3B4\_hR7\_166\_ac\_2c. They are generated by the same symmetry operations with different sets of parameters ({\tt --params}) specified in their corresponding CIF files. 
 Hexagonal settings of this structure can be obtained with the option {\tt --hex}.
